detaileddescription.para: Draw the main portion of the object
Draw extras on the object
Check if the object fully covers the 'mask_p' area
Design modes
Draw ready
Returned on LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK if the areas is fully covered
Returned on LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK if the areas is not covered
Returned on LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK if the areas is masked out (children also not cover)
Design results
The object has been pressed
The object is being pressed (called continuously while pressing)
User is still pressing but slid cursor/finger off of the object
User pressed object for a short period of time, then released it. Not called if dragged.
Object has been pressed for at least LV_INDEV_LONG_PRESS_TIME. Not called if dragged.
Called after LV_INDEV_LONG_PRESS_TIME in every LV_INDEV_LONG_PRESS_REP_TIME ms. Not called if dragged.
Called on release if not dragged (regardless to long press)
Called in every cases when the object has been released
The object has been getture
The object's value has changed (i.e. slider moved)
"Ok", "Apply" or similar specific button has clicked
"Close", "Cancel" or similar specific button has clicked
Object is being deleted
Object is being deleted
Child was removed/added
Object coordinates/size have changed
Parent's size has changed
Object's style has changed
The base dir has changed
Object's extra padding has changed
LittlevGL needs to retrieve the object's type
Get the style of an object
Get the state of the object
Advanced hit-testing
The object has been pressed
The object is being pressed (called continuously while pressing)
User is still pressing but slid cursor/finger off of the object
User pressed object for a short period of time, then released it. Not called if dragged.
Object has been pressed for at least LV_INDEV_LONG_PRESS_TIME. Not called if dragged.
Called after LV_INDEV_LONG_PRESS_TIME in every LV_INDEV_LONG_PRESS_REP_TIME ms. Not called if dragged.
The object has been gesture
Another object is clicked or chosen via an input device
Signals are for use by the object itself or to extend the object's functionality. Applications should use lv_obj_set_event_cb to be notified of events that occur on the object.
Disable the child change signal. Used by the library
Prevent automatic parent change (e.g. in lv_page)
Prevent automatic positioning (e.g. in lv_cont layout)
Prevent the object be followed in automatic ordering (e.g. in lv_cont PRETTY layout)
If the indev was pressing this object but swiped out while pressing do not search other object.
Prevent focusing the object by clicking on it

memberdef.definition: typedef lv_design_res_t(* lv_design_cb_t) (struct _lv_obj_t *obj, const lv_area_t *clip_area, lv_design_mode_t mode)
memberdef.name: lv_design_cb_t

detaileddescription.para: The design callback is used to draw the object on the screen. It accepts the object, a mask area, and the mode in which to draw the object.
Type of event being sent to the object.

briefdescription.para: Event callback. Events are used to notify the user of some action being taken on the object. For details, see lv_event_t.

memberdef.definition: typedef lv_res_t(* lv_signal_cb_t) (struct _lv_obj_t *obj, lv_signal_t sign, void *param)
memberdef.name: lv_signal_cb_t

detaileddescription.para: Init. the 'lv' library.
Deinit the 'lv' library Currently only implemented when not using custom allocators, or GC is enabled.

Create a basic object
parent
pointer to a parent object. If NULL then a screen will be created
copy
pointer to a base object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the new object

Delete 'obj' and all of its children
obj
pointer to an object to delete
LV_RES_INV because the object is deleted

A function to be easily used in animation ready callback to delete an object when the animation is ready
a
pointer to the animation

Helper function for asynchronously deleting objects. Useful for cases where you can't delete an object directly in an LV_EVENT_DELETE handler (i.e. parent).
obj
object to delete
lv_async_call

Delete all children of an object
obj
pointer to an object

Mark an area of an object as invalid. This area will be redrawn by 'lv_refr_task'
obj
pointer to an object
area
the area to redraw

Mark the object as invalid therefore its current position will be redrawn by 'lv_refr_task'
obj
pointer to an object

Set a new parent for an object. Its relative position will be the same.
obj
pointer to an object. Can't be a screen.
parent
pointer to the new parent object. (Can't be NULL)

Move and object to the foreground

pointer to an object

Move and object to the background

pointer to an object

x
new distance from the left side of the parent
y
new distance from the top of the parent

pointer to an object

Set the width of an object by taking the left and right margin into account. The object heigwidthht will be obj_w = w - margon_left - margin_right

Set the height of an object by taking the top and bottom margin into account. The object height will be obj_h = h - margon_top - margin_bottom

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *obj, const lv_obj_t *base, lv_align_t align, lv_coord_t x_mod, lv_coord_t y_mod)
memberdef.name: lv_obj_align

detaileddescription.para:
Align an object to an other object.
obj
pointer to an object to align
base
pointer to an object (if NULL the parent is used). 'obj' will be aligned to it.
align
type of alignment (see 'lv_align_t' enum)
x_mod
x coordinate shift after alignment
y_mod
y coordinate shift after alignment

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *obj, const lv_obj_t *base, lv_align_t align, lv_coord_t x_mod, lv_coord_t y_mod)
memberdef.name: lv_obj_align_origo

detaileddescription.para:
Align an object to an other object.
obj
pointer to an object to align
base
pointer to an object (if NULL the parent is used). 'obj' will be aligned to it.
align
type of alignment (see 'lv_align_t' enum)
x_mod
x coordinate shift after alignment
y_mod
y coordinate shift after alignment

Realign the object based on the last lv_obj_align parameters.
obj
pointer to an object

Enable the automatic realign of the object when its size has changed based on the last lv_obj_align parameters.
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable auto realign; false: disable auto realign

detaileddescription.para:
Set the size of an extended clickable area
obj
pointer to an object
left
extended clickable are on the left [px]
right
extended clickable are on the right [px]
top
extended clickable are on the top [px]
bottom
extended clickable are on the bottom [px]

Add a new stye to the style list of an object.
obj
pointer to an object
part
the part of the object which style property should be set. E.g. LV_OBJ_PART_MAIN, LV_BTN_PART_MAIN, LV_SLIDER_PART_KNOB
style
pointer to a style to add (Only its pointer will be saved)

Reset a style to the default (empty) state. Release all used memories and cancel pending related transitions. Typically used in `LV_SIGN_CLEAN_UP.
obj
pointer to an object
part
the part of the object which style list should be reseted. E.g. LV_OBJ_PART_MAIN, LV_BTN_PART_MAIN, LV_SLIDER_PART_KNOB

Reset a style to the default (empty) state. Release all used memories and cancel pending related transitions. Also notifies the object about the style change.
obj
pointer to an object
part
the part of the object which style list should be reseted. E.g. LV_OBJ_PART_MAIN, LV_BTN_PART_MAIN, LV_SLIDER_PART_KNOB

Notify an object about its style is modified
obj
pointer to an object

Notify all object if a style is modified
style
pointer to a style. Only the objects with this style will be notified (NULL to notify all objects)

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *obj, uint8_t type, lv_style_property_t prop, lv_color_t color)
memberdef.name: _lv_obj_set_style_local_color

detaileddescription.para:
Set a local style property of a part of an object in a given state.
obj
pointer to an object
part
the part of the object which style property should be set. E.g. LV_OBJ_PART_MAIN, LV_BTN_PART_MAIN, LV_SLIDER_PART_KNOB
prop
a style property ORed with a state. E.g. LV_STYLE_BORDER_COLOR | (LV_STATE_PRESSED << LV_STYLE_STATE_POS)
the
value to set
shouldn't be used directly. Use the specific property get functions instead. For example: lv_obj_style_get_border_opa()
for performance reasons it's not checked if the property really has color type

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *obj, uint8_t type, lv_style_property_t prop, lv_style_int_t value)
memberdef.name: _lv_obj_set_style_local_int

detaileddescription.para:
Set a local style property of a part of an object in a given state.
obj
pointer to an object
part
the part of the object which style property should be set. E.g. LV_OBJ_PART_MAIN, LV_BTN_PART_MAIN, LV_SLIDER_PART_KNOB
prop
a style property ORed with a state. E.g. LV_STYLE_BORDER_WIDTH | (LV_STATE_PRESSED << LV_STYLE_STATE_POS)
the
value to set
shouldn't be used directly. Use the specific property get functions instead. For example: lv_obj_style_get_border_opa()
for performance reasons it's not checked if the property really has integer type

detaileddescription.para:
Set a local style property of a part of an object in a given state.
obj
pointer to an object
part
the part of the object which style property should be set. E.g. LV_OBJ_PART_MAIN, LV_BTN_PART_MAIN, LV_SLIDER_PART_KNOB
prop
a style property ORed with a state. E.g. LV_STYLE_TEXT_FONT | (LV_STATE_PRESSED << LV_STYLE_STATE_POS)
the
value to set
shouldn't be used directly. Use the specific property get functions instead. For example: lv_obj_style_get_text_font()
for performance reasons it's not checked if the property really has pointer type

Remove a local style property from a part of an object with a given state.
obj
pointer to an object
part
the part of the object which style property should be removed. E.g. LV_OBJ_PART_MAIN, LV_BTN_PART_MAIN, LV_SLIDER_PART_KNOB
prop
a style property ORed with a state. E.g. LV_STYLE_TEXT_FONT | (LV_STATE_PRESSED << LV_STYLE_STATE_POS)
shouldn't be used directly. Use the specific property remove functions instead. For example: lv_obj_style_remove_border_opa()
true: the property was found and removed; false: teh property was not found

Hide an object. It won't be visible and clickable.
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: hide the object

Set whether advanced hit-testing is enabled on an object
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: advanced hit-testing is enabled

Enable or disable the clicking of an object
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: make the object clickable

Enable to bring this object to the foreground if it or any of its children is clicked
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable the auto top feature

Enable the dragging of an object
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: make the object dragable

Set the directions an object can be dragged in
obj
pointer to an object
drag_dir
bitwise OR of allowed drag directions

Enable the throwing of an object after is is dragged
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable the drag throw

Enable to use parent for drag related operations. If trying to drag the object the parent will be moved instead
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable the 'drag parent' for the object

Enable to use parent for gesture related operations. If trying to gesture the object the parent will be moved instead
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable the 'gesture parent' for the object

Propagate the events to the parent too
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable the event propagation

Set the base direction of the object
obj
pointer to an object
dir
the new base direction. LV_BIDI_DIR_LTR/RTL/AUTO/INHERIT

Set a bit or bits in the protect filed
obj
pointer to an object
prot
'OR'-ed values from lv_protect_t

Clear a bit or bits in the protect filed
obj
pointer to an object
prot
'OR'-ed values from lv_protect_t

Set the state (fully overwrite) of an object. If specified in the styles a transition animation will be started from the previous state to the current
obj
pointer to an object
state
the new state

Add a given state or states to the object. The other state bits will remain unchanged. If specified in the styles a transition animation will be started from the previous state to the current
obj
pointer to an object
state
the state bits to add. E.g LV_STATE_PRESSED | LV_STATE_FOCUSED

Remove a given state or states to the object. The other state bits will remain unchanged. If specified in the styles a transition animation will be started from the previous state to the current
obj
pointer to an object
state
the state bits to remove. E.g LV_STATE_PRESSED | LV_STATE_FOCUSED

Finish all pending transitions on a part of an object
obj
pointer to an object
part
part of the object, e.g LV_BRN_PART_MAIN or LV_OBJ_PART_ALL for all parts

Set a an event handler function for an object. Used by the user to react on event which happens with the object.
obj
pointer to an object
event_cb
the new event function

Send an event to the object
obj
pointer to an object
event
the type of the event from lv_event_t.
data
arbitrary data depending on the object type and the event. (Usually NULL)
LV_RES_OK: obj was not deleted in the event; LV_RES_INV: obj was deleted in the event

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_event_cb_t event_xcb, lv_obj_t *obj, lv_event_t event, const void *data)
memberdef.name: lv_event_send_func

detaileddescription.para:
Call an event function with an object, event, and data.
event_xcb
an event callback function. If NULL LV_RES_OK will return without any actions. (the 'x' in the argument name indicates that its not a fully generic function because it not follows the func_name(object, callback, ...) convention)
obj
pointer to an object to associate with the event (can be NULL to simply call the event_cb)
event
an event
data
pointer to a custom data
LV_RES_OK: obj was not deleted in the event; LV_RES_INV: obj was deleted in the event

Get the data parameter of the current event
the data parameter

pointer to an object
signal_cb

pointer to an object
event
the type of the event from lv_event_t.
LV_RES_OK or LV_RES_INV

the height including thee margins

Divide the width of the object and get the width of a given number of columns. Take paddings into account.
obj
pointer to an object
div
indicates how many columns are assumed. If 1 the width will be set the the parent's width If 2 only half parent width - inner padding of the parent If 3 only third parent width - 2 * inner padding of the parent

the width according to the given parameters

Divide the height of the object and get the width of a given number of columns. Take paddings into account.

pointer to an object

indicates how many rows are assumed. If 1 the height will be set the the parent's height If 2 only half parent height - inner padding of the parent If 3 only third parent height - 2 * inner padding of the parent

Get a style property of a part of an object in the object's current state. If there is a running transitions it is taken into account
obj
pointer to an object
part
the part of the object which style property should be get. E.g. LV_OBJ_PART_MAIN, LV_BTN_PART_MAIN, LV_SLIDER_PART_KNOB

the property to get. E.g. LV_STYLE_BORDER_WIDTH. The state of the object will be added internally
the value of the property of the given part in the current state. If the property is not found a default value will be returned.
shouldn't be used directly. Use the specific property get functions instead. For example: lv_obj_style_get_border_width()
for performance reasons it's not checked if the property really has integer type

pointer to an object
true: opa scaling is enabled for this object and all children; false: no opa scaling

Get the opa scale parameter of an object
obj
pointer to an object
opa scale [0..255]

Get the protect field of an object
obj
pointer to an object
protect field ('OR'ed values of lv_protect_t)

Check at least one bit of a given protect bitfield is set
obj
pointer to an object
prot
protect bits to test ('OR'ed values of lv_protect_t)
false: none of the given bits are set, true: at least one bit is set

Get the signal function of an object
obj
pointer to an object
the signal function

Get the design function of an object
obj
pointer to an object
the design function

Get the event function of an object
obj
pointer to an object
the event function
Check if a given screen-space point is on an object's coordinates.

This method is intended to be used mainly by advanced hit testing algorithms to check whether the point is even within the object (as an optimization).
obj
object to check
point
screen-space point

Hit-test an object given a particular point in screen space.
obj
object to hit-test
point
screen-space point
true if the object is considered under the point

Get the ext pointer
obj
pointer to an object
the ext pointer but not the dynamic version Use it as ext->data1, and NOT da(ext)->data1

Get object's and its ancestors type. Put their name in type_buf starting with the current type. E.g. buf.type[0]="lv_btn", buf.type[1]="lv_cont", buf.type[2]="lv_obj"
obj
pointer to an object which type should be get
buf
pointer to an lv_obj_type_t buffer to store the types

Get the object's user data
obj
pointer to an object
user data

Get a pointer to the object's user data
obj
pointer to an object
pointer to the user data

Set the object's user data. The data will be copied.
obj
pointer to an object
data
user data

Get the group of the object
obj
pointer to an object
the pointer to group of the object

Tell whether the object is the focused object of a group or not.
obj
pointer to an object
true: the object is focused, false: the object is not focused or not in a group

Used in the signal callback to handle LV_SIGNAL_GET_TYPE signal
buf
pointer to lv_obj_type_t. (param in the signal callback)
name
name of the object. E.g. "lv_btn". (Only the pointer is saved)
LV_RES_OK

Initialize a rectangle descriptor from an object's styles
obj
pointer to an object
type
type of style. E.g. LV_OBJ_PART_MAIN, LV_BTN_STYLE_REL or LV_PAGE_STYLE_SCRL
draw_dsc
the descriptor the initialize
Only the relevant fields will be set. E.g. if border width == 0 the other border properties won't be evaluated.

Get the required extra size (around the object's part) to draw shadow, outline, value etc.
obj
poinr to an object
part
part of the object

Fade in (from transparent to fully cover) an object and all its children using an opa_scale animation.
obj
the object to fade in
time
duration of the animation [ms]
delay
wait before the animation starts [ms]

Fade out (from fully cover to transparent) an object and all its children using an opa_scale animation.
obj
the object to fade in
time
duration of the animation [ms]
delay
wait before the animation starts [ms]
